title: EXCLUSIVE: Brendan Fraser Is a 'Token White Guy' For Hire in 'Rental Family' Clip
summary: Brendan Fraser stars as Phillip, a struggling actor who learns about a Japanese rental service, in an exclusive clip from his new movie, "Rental Family."
story: Brendan Fraser is a lonely, struggling actor just trying to find a real connection in his new movie, “Rental Family.”

Set in modern-day Tokyo, the forthcoming comedic drama follows the Oscar winner’s character, Phillip, who has been taking odd jobs in hopes of landing his big break. However, his life completely changes when he books one unusual role with a company: a Japanese “rental family” agency where paid actors pose as family members, friends and romantic partners, among other roles, for specific situations.
Ahead of the film’s Nov. 21 release, TODAY.com has an exclusive clip of Phillip learning about all the ways being part of a rental company can make a difference.
“So what do you think we do?” Shinji (Takehiro Hira) asks Phillip at his office.
“You, if I have to guess, you sell people,” Phillip replies with a hesitant laugh.
“No,” Shinji says. “We sell emotion. We play roles in a client’s lives.”
When Phillip says the agency can’t “replace someone in your life,” Shinji disagrees.

“Yes and no,” he responds before adding, “but people are willing to take a leap.” Shinji notes the many ways actors can fill in for others. “The actor, the surrogate — you don’t have to be that person. You just have to help clients connect to what’s missing.”
So why would the company need someone like Phillip? Well, as Shinji explains, they “need a token white guy.”
When Phillip appears doubtful, Shinji adds that he’s giving him an opportunity, as an actor, to “play roles with a real meaning.”
Directed and co-written by Hikari, “Rental Family” examines human connection, as well as the moral complexities that Phillip begins to feel once he starts working with the company.
“Rental Family” is loosely based on the real-life Japanese rental family businesses throughout the country.
Hikari tells TODAY.com that when she first heard of the services, she discovered “that people are really longing for connection” amid feelings of isolation.
“I just wanted to make a movie that connects the audience,” she shares. “And have them look within themselves or pick up the phone and say, ‘Hey, what are you doing?’”

title: TODAY Spends an Afternoon With S.COUPS and MINGYU in Los Angeles
summary: S.COUPS and MINGYU, two members of best-selling K-Pop group, SEVENTEEN, released their unit project, "Hype Vibes," in September 2025.
story: S.COUPS and MINGYU, two members of best-selling K-Pop group, SEVENTEEN, released their unit project, "Hype Vibes," in September 2025. The two members chose to produce and record a majority of the mini album in Los Angeles and Hawaii.
TODAY spent an afternoon hanging out in downtown Los Angeles with the two superstars, chatting about their growth as artists, tattoos, travel and Formula 1.
Watch our full interview with S.COUPS and MINGYU on TikTok.

title: Why Glen Powell Flew Out a UPS Driver To Attend His 'SNL' Hosting Debut
summary: Glen Powell’s “Saturday Night Live” monologue was a full circle moment for the actor — and a surprise guest
story: Glen Powell’s “Saturday Night Live” monologue was a full circle moment for the actor — and a surprise guest.
Powell, who stars in the new film “The Running Man,” made his “SNL” hosting debut Nov. 15 alongside musical guest Olivia Dean.

During his opening monologue, Powell recalled how he was supposed to host the late-night sketch comedy show four years ago to promote “Top Gun: Maverick,” but his plans were thwarted by a pushed release date for the film.

“When I got the call, I was on a porch with my family and we all just lost our minds,” Powell explained. “We were jumping up and down celebrating, and a UPS driver happened to be delivering a package at that exact same moment and he was like, ‘What is going on?’”
Powell explained to the UPS driver that he had gotten the call to host “SNL” and told the driver to tune in for the Christmas episode that season.

“And so we all took a selfie with him, and this is the selfie to mark the occasion,” Powell said, before showing a photo posing with the UPS driver as well as his parents and sisters. “So that’s me and my whole family and the UPS driver.”
However, Powell said his “dream got taken away” after the “Top Gun: Maverick” release was delayed due to the pandemic, and “SNL” rescinded the offer for him to host.
Powell joked that the show’s creator and producer, Lorne Michaels, called him and told him that without “Top Gun: Maverick,” nobody “will know who the eff you are.”

“So, I didn’t end up hosting, which means for four years, this UPS driver was just going around saying Glen Powell is a liar,” Powell said. “So now, I am here hosting. It feels amazing. But what feels even better is proving to this UPS driver that I am not crazy.”
In a surprise twist, Powell then shared that his sisters, Lauren and Leslie, were able to track down the UPS driver, joking that the women in his family “are terrifying.”

“They found the cell number of this UPS guy, his name is Mitch,” Powell said. “So to prove to Mitch that I am not a liar, I flew him all the way to New York — coach, I don’t know how ‘The Running Man’ is going to do yet — but I flew him here, and he thought it was a scam, but he still came. And he is sitting in the audience tonight, so let’s give it up for Mitch, the UPS guy.”

The camera panned to Mitch sitting in the audience as he gave a wave to the camera. Powell then invited Mitch onto the stage of Studio 8H to re-create that original selfie and “bring this thing full circle.”
While this marked Powell’s first time hosting the late-night sketch comedy show, the actor made two brief appearances in March 2024 during his “Anyone But You” co-star Sydney Sweeney’s hosting debut.

During her monologue, Sweeney called out the “craziest rumor” she’d heard about herself online, which was that she and Powell had an affair while they filmed the 2023 rom-com. Sweeney refuted the rumors and said her then-fiancé, Jonathan Davino, produced the movie and he was with the duo the entire time during filming.
Sweeney added that Davino was in the audience to show his support. But the cameras cut to Powell smiling in the audience, leaving Sweeney to yell, “That’s not my fiancé! He’s in my dressing room!”

Powell also appeared during a sketch called “Loud Table,” which featured Sweeney on a date with her boyfriend, played by Andrew Dismukes. However, during the date, Sweeney confessed she cheated on him with her boss, played by none other than Powell.

title: Leanne Morgan Got Her Big Break at 54. Why She Calls It 'Wonderful Timing'
summary: On "Sunday Sitdown with Willie Geist," Leanne Morgan revealed how Jerry Seinfeld's reacted when he learned she got her own self-titled show on Netflix.
story: Getting her own Netflix show was a breakout moment for Leanne Morgan.
Her series "Leanne" has been renewed for a second season, and the comedian tells Willie Geist she was "thrilled" to see it do so well.
"Jerry Seinfeld called me the day it came out, and said, 'You have a sitcom with your name on it, which is unheard of,'" she said on the Nov. 16 episode of Sunday Sitdown.
"And he goes, 'You’re in there with Bob Newhart, Mary Tyler Moore, Lucille Ball,'" she added.
Morgan spent many years working as a struggling comedian. After graduating from the University of Tennessee, the comic started a family with her husband, Chuck, and realized comedy was her calling.
While selling jewelry at home parties, she would joke about her life at home with her husband, whom she always calls "Chuck Morgan."

"I was talking about having hemorrhoids, breast feeding, Chuck Morgan not hearing the baby cry in the night ... all that kinda stuff," she said. "And that was my first material. People would say, 'You need to be a stand-up.'"
Morgan took their words to heart. While raising her kids during the day, she would take the stage at any comedy club that would have her during the night.
Morgan said she faced plenty of rejection. "I just felt like I was never one of the cool kids," she told Willie.
Everything changed once she decided to hire social media experts to get her career going. She was 54 at the time.
"It went like gang busters," she said of finding success. "Clubs started calling all over the United States, saying, 'We need to get Leanne Morgan here.'

"Now, six months before that, they were like, 'She’s sweet. She doesn’t get drunk and fight in the parking lot. But we’re not having her back. She cannot sell tickets,'" Morgan recalled. "And I would be so hurt. And then, honey, started selling out all over the United States."
Morgan's sold out shows helped her land "Leanne" and her two comedy specials — "I’m Every Woman" and "Unspeakable Things" — at Netflix.
"It’s like a whirlwind, my darling, and you know what people say to me all the time? They go, 'How are you doing this?'" she said of juggling her various commitments.
While looking back at how far she's come in her career, Morgan said she's happy with how everything turned out.
“I look back on it and I think, it was wonderful timing,” she said.

"I got to raise these children. I have led a full life as a mama, a grandmama, my parents are still with me," she added. "I’ve got this full life I can talk about, and that’s what people are relating to."

title: Teresa Giudice Details Shock Reconciliation with Joe and Melissa Gorga After Years-Long Feud
summary: "Real Housewives of New Jersey" star Teresa Giudice says she's ended her years-long feud with her brother, Joe Gorga, and his wife, Melissa Gorga.
story: "Real Housewives of New Jersey" star Teresa Giudice is putting the past behind her.
At BravoCon 2025, Giudice revealed that she has started to mend her relationship with her brother, Joe Gorga, and his wife, Melissa Gorga, after a years-long feud.

"I don't know if everyone heard, but my brother and Melissa, we have talked and things are going in the right direction, so I'm really happy about it," she said while on stage with some of the other housewives at the event.
In another clip from the convention, which will run until Nov. 16 in Las Vegas, Giudice and Joe Gorga share a hug.
According to Bravo, Giudice said she was willing to put the past behind her after meeting with her brother at their late parents' grave.
“I talked to my brother, first — because I thought that was only right — he was like, really happy to see me. I was happy to see him," she said.
“At first, he didn’t want to meet there. He said, ‘That’s weird.’ I’m like, ‘No, it’s not weird.’ Because I didn’t want anybody to take photos of us or anything like that,” she shared.
Giudice explained that she found the area "peaceful" and thought it was a place where Joe Gorga could keep his cool. Giudice said her brother had "tears in his eyes" during their conversation.
Now, she said that they're in a "good place" and she would like her kids to hang out with Joe and Melissa Gorga.

“I want him in my life, I want his wife in my life, my sister-in-law, my niece and nephews in my life,” she added. “Like, that’s the most important thing. Like, I want the kids to hang out. But when it’s toxic between the parents, the kids don’t want to hang out.”

Melissa Gorga also alluded to their reconciliation in a Nov. 15 Instagram post. The fellow "Real Housewives of New Jersey" star shared a picture of her, Joe Gorga, Giudice and Giudice's husband, Luis Ruelas, posing for a picture together at BravoCon.
She captioned the snap, "Don’t question it - Just support it #family."

title: New TikTok Trend Has People Posting Their Family Members' Wildest Texts
summary: A new trend has been going viral on TikTok where social media users are sharing the funny text messages that they get from their family members.
story: TikTokers are putting their family members on blast.
On social media, users are sharing the kinds of text messages they receive from family members that you simply have to "read and move on."
The trend consists of creators sharing screenshots of funny texts from parents, siblings and more. The messages range from moms' overly concerned messages to dads' out of pocket jokes.
One video that's amassed more than 700,000 likes is from creator Audrey Saxton of Dallas, Texas. The 27-year-old shared a screenshot of a funny conversation she had with her father.

At the beginning of the message, Saxton's dad reminded her to wish her mother a "happy mom day." But when she asked if there are any pictures from when she was a baby, her father responded with a surprising question.
"Who is this," he replied.
“Sometimes you have to read your dads text and move on,” she wrote over a screenshot of the message.
Saxton tells TODAY.com that she responded to her dad's message with "15 question marks." And in true dad joke fashion, he replied he was "just kidding."
"Our texts messages never make any sense. They are always shorthanded or someone’s responding days later and I knew that we would have something funny," she says.
In another viral video, 25-year-old Ohio native Rania Saleh shared a series of text messages with her niece.
In the screenshot, Saleh's 16-year-old niece, Riyah, told her she misses her. After Saleh responded, "I actually miss you more," her niece explained why she started thinking of her.
"I thought about you today bc in ap psych we learned about how peoples mental and physical health starts to decline in their mid twenties," the 16-year-old wrote.
Like viewers, Saleh tells TODAY.com she burst out laughing once she read the message.

"I gasped and just died laughing!" she says. "I was like, wow, I guess I really am entering my mid-20s but I’m going to prove her psych teacher wrong! I’m happy she thought of me but I was just shocked that that’s what reminded her to text me and check in!"

"Although it was super funny, it was also really sweet of her," she adds. "I remember sending the text to all of my siblings, including her mom and they were all like 'Yup! That sounds like something Riyah would send.' It made everyone’s day."
The "read and move on" trend has resonated with social users because of its relatability.
Oluwaseye Oyelowo, a 25-year-old from Atlanta, Georgia, agrees. When she heard about the trend, she decided to get in on the fun by roasting her 22-year-old sister, Oluwasayo.
"I felt like people should see the funny relationship that I have with my younger sister and how comfortable she is with me," she tells TODAY.com.
In her post, Oluwasayo out of the blue asked her older sister, "When do you get paid and how much can I get?"
Oyelowo says with a laugh that the message is true to form for her sister.

"Growing up it was mainly my mom providing for us and now that I’m working, I always make it be known that they can ask for anything, just to help remove a load off our mother. So yes, that is the normal for us," she says. “She’s very forward with her requests and I just chuckle because I know her and read her message in her voice."
So much so that sometimes, "you have to look at your sister's text message and move on with your day," as Oyelowo captioned the video.
Oyelowo also received a fitting reaction from her sister once she told her their messages went viral.
"I called my sister and said ‘You’re famous,’” Oyelowo says with a laugh. "And she said she’s putting interest on the money she wanted me to give for using her."

title: 'All Her Fault' Author Recalls the Real-Life Moment That Inspired Her Book
summary: All Her Fault author Andrea Mara speaks out about the real inspiration behind the show All Her Fault.
story: When “All Her Fault” author Andrea Mara’s middle daughter was 5 years old, she went to pick her up for a playdate. She drove to the address listed on the school directory and rang the doorbell. No answer. She rang again. Still not an answer.
Then, she peered inside the window — and her heart stopped.

“There was no furniture in the house. Nobody lived in the house. My heart nearly jumped out of my chest with fright, and I immediately thought, ‘Oh, my God, my child has been kidnapped,’” Mara tells TODAY.com.
Mara feared it was a fake playdate and her child had been taken. “I think lots of parents can probably relate to that, that your mind goes to the worst case scenario,” she says.
Then, a neighbor popped her head out to reveal the owners had moved just weeks prior, so the printed out school directory wasn’t up-to-date.
Mara was able to pick her daughter up from the correct address, but the scenario never left her. When she was looking to write her fourth novel, she returned to the concept.
“I thought, ‘OK, I think I want to write that playdate book,’” she says.

That “playdate book” became “All Her Fault,” published in 2021 and adapted into a Peacock drama released earlier this month, starring actor Sarah Snook. In the book and series, Marissa and Peter Irvine's lives are thrown into turmoil when their young son Milo goes missing during a playdate. It turns out he's been kidnapped, just as Mara feared in her own imagination.

Beyond the unguessable twists, “All Her Fault” is starting conversations about division of labor and why women bear the brunt of the responsibility for day-to-day life and are blamed when it goes awry. The show’s main husbands, Peter (Jake Lacy) and Richie (Thomas Cocquerel), are on a spectrum of problematic, ranging from sociopathic to inept.

“(My husband) has been watching the show with me, and he’s kind of like, ‘Come on. Please say this isn’t based on me.’ And I said to him, ‘Look, you weren’t listening to me, so I had to write a book,’” she says, laughing.

While she says her husband is nothing like Richie, who leaves his wife to figure out all the details of their child’s life, she did often feel like the “default parent,” forced to do more of the problem-solving.
Mara, who describes herself as an “overthinker,” says she uses her novels as a way to work through scenarios.
“Writing books is therapy, so I get it all out of my system by writing the book and just pushing it on to other people,” she says.
She has a 28-page-long document with a running list of ideas for crime novels inspired by real-life scenarios.
Her next book, “It Should Have Been You,” out in 2026, imagines what might happen if someone sent a mean text about a neighbor to the neighborhood group text. Then, four people wind up dead.

“I have a big neighborhood Whatsapp group here, and they think it’s very funny that I made a whole book out of the messages they send in error in our group. Everyone’s like, ‘Oh, be careful. She’s probably reading these messages for her new book,’” she says.

title: Cynthia Erivo and Misty Copeland Duet Stripped-Down Rendition of ‘No Good Deed’ from ‘Wicked’
summary: Misty Copeland and Cynthia Erivo reunited for a live performance of "No Good Deed" ahead of the upcoming release of "Wicked: For Good."
story: Misty Copeland and Cynthia Erivo are back at it again.
The Tony winner and legendary ballerina reunited for a live performance of "No Good Deed," a song featured in "Wicked: For Good," in anticipation of the Nov. 21 release of the film.
In the clip, Copeland dances around Erivo as the Grammy-winning singer belts out a stripped-down version of the tune.
For the performance, Erivo donned a gorgeous green backless dress that paid homage to her "Wicked" character, Elphaba, and Copeland wore a flowing champagne-colored gown.
At the end of the video, which was shared on the official YouTube accounts of “Wicked: For Good” and Universal Pictures, the friends smiled and gave one another a hug.
Copeland and Erivo also shared the phenomenal video on their Instagram accounts, where they received rave reviews.
"You got these two masters of their craft in one room?! 😍" one person wrote.
"Obsessed," another said.
A third added, "This power couple i knew i always needed 🩰👏🏼🤍."

Ten years ago, the pair previously dueted in an "impromptu collaboration," which Copeland also shared on Instagram in 2024. In the video, she danced around a ballet studio in a flowing pink dress while Erivo accompanied her on vocals.
"An unforgettable moment with @cynthiaerivo! 🩰 Congratulations on your incredible #Wicked performance✨," Copeland penned the caption.
In October, Copeland retired from her role as a principal dancer at the American Ballet Theatre. Though she's no longer with the company, she still holds dance close to her heart.

In an interview with Harper’s Bazaar, Copeland said she plans to “continue performing in some capacity.” In a statement from the American Ballet Theatre, Copeland added that her retirement "isn't a farewell."
“I could never have imagined the life ballet would give me," Copeland said at the time.
"This moment isn’t a farewell, it’s a celebration of everything we’ve built together, and a step toward all the work that’s still ahead," she added.

title: Jessi Ngatikaura Gives an Update on Her Marriage After Rocky 'Mormon Wives' Season 3
summary: Are Jessi and Jordan Ngatikaura from The Secret Lives of Mormon Wives still together now?
story: Jessi Ngatikaura gives an update on the status of her marriage in the Season 3 finale of "The Secret Lives of Mormon Wives."
Ever since the Season 2 finale aired, fans of the Hulu series have been wondering whether the reality star was still married to her husband, Jordan Ngatikaura, amid ongoing rumors of infidelity.
Season 3 finds the couple undergoing a 90-day separation and sheds light on Jessi Ngatikaura's emotional affair with "Vanderpump Villa" star Marciano Brunette.
Did the Ngatikauras decide to stay together at the end of the season or are they headed for divorce? Here's a look back at their marital woes and an update on where their relationship stands.
Season 2 Ended with Rumors of Infidelity in Jessi's Marriage
While filming Season 2, the #MomTok ladies visited Lisa Vanderpump’s villa in Italy as guest stars in the show "Vanderpump Villa."

Rumors quickly spread that Demi Engemann had developed a connection with Marciano Brunette, one of the villa's staff members and a "Vanderpump Villa" star. Engemann, who is married, denied the rumors.

Brunette spoke with Taylor Frankie Paul at the end of Season 2 and said he actually was romantically involved with Jessi Ngatikaura, not Engemann. Jessi Ngatikaura alluded to the rumor in a preview of Season 3, saying, “He knows that this is ruining my family, my life.”
She also blamed Engemann, saying, “This is Demi’s doing.”
Jessi Admitted to an 'Emotional Affair' During Season 3

Viewers got some of the answers they'd been waiting for when Season 3 premiered on Nov. 13. Jessi Ngatikaura admitted that she had an emotional affair with Brunette after meeting him at Vanderpump's villa, but denied his claims that they had slept together.

While speaking with her co-star Layla Taylor, Jessi Ngatikaura opened up about the affair and revealed that she and her husband had separated briefly before she met Brunette. At the villa, she said she and Brunette kissed a few times.

The Ngatikauras agreed to speak candidly about their marital problems. In a confessional interview in Episode 1, Jessi Ngatikaura expressed remorse for her actions, saying, "I just feel so regretful and I’m so disappointed in myself."
Jordan Ngatikaura later said he felt "emotionally abandoned" by his wife after the affair.
Jessi and Jordan Embarked on a 90-Day Separation
Throughout Season 3, the Ngatikauras underwent a 90-day separation. While speaking with the other #MomTok ladies, Jessi Ngatikaura shared the text messages she'd exchanged with Brunette.

Later on in the season, Brunette admitted that he had lied about sleeping with Jessi Ngatikaura and claimed that Engemann pressured him to do so. She later denied his claims. Brunette also said he had kissed Engemann.
Brunette and Jessi Ngatikaura met in person to clear the air and took a lie detector test to prove that they weren't lying about not sleeping together.

While reviewing the results, Jessi Ngatikaura was pleased to see that her response was "true" when she said she hadn't slept with Brunette. Some of the other responses she gave were inconclusive, however.

For instance, when asked if she had any sexual contact with Brunette aside from their two kisses, she said no and the results said "inconclusive." When asked if she had lied about anything involving Brunette, Jessi Ngatikaura said no but the results said "significant reaction failed."
During a discussion with his wife, Jordan Ngatikaura said he was frustrated that she went out to eat with Brunette and her friends after the lie detector test.

While speaking with her co-stars later in the season, Jessi Ngatikaura said she and her husband had been struggling in their marriage for three years. She cited several behaviors from Jordan Ngatikaura, including “name calling, talking down to me, yelling” that had all contributed to their separation.
“I didn’t do anything right: parenting laundry, housework," she said.
What Jessi Told TODAY.com About Her Season 3 Journey

During a recent video call with TODAY.com, Jessi Ngatikaura said it's "always scary to put yourself out there" when you're addressing sensitive topics on camera. However, she and her husband were on the same page in that they wanted to be honest with viewers.

"When we started talking about it on camera, we both agreed that if we’re going to do this, we’re going to do it 100%. We’re going to own our s---. We’re going to talk about the mistakes we’ve made and take the audience along on the journey," she said.
The reality star said everyone has "been through ups and downs in a relationship" and can relate to her story in one way or other.
"So just showcasing that and showing that we’re in therapy, we’re working on things, and we’ll see where it goes," she said.
In the end, Jessi Ngatikaura said she wanted to showcase the highs and lows of her marriage to offer an authentic view of their relationship.

"Hopefully that can help someone, similar to what Jen and Zac (Affleck) did in Season 1 and 2. They kind of put it all out there and I think it’s strengthened their marriage over time. And I’m hoping it’ll do the same for us," she said.
Are Jessi and Jordan Still Together?

Towards the end of Season 3, Jessi Ngatikaura said she was feeling "hopeful" about the future of her marriage. In the season finale, the couple agreed to end their separation and give their relationship another try.

"I want to make it work with you — not out of necessity, but because that's what I want because I can't imagine my life without you. And I believe that we both deserve to put what's happened behind us and try to move forward from it," Jordan Ngatikaura told his wife.
Jessi Ngatikaura was happy to hear this reassurance from her husband but expressed her concerns.

"Throughout this whole separation, I've been in limbo of like really not knowing what I wanted and I'm still scared. My biggest fear is that we're going to move back in together and get back together and give it a chance and it's just going to go right back to how it was, and that's it's easy to just get comfortable and fall back into old patterns, you know? So I am really scared of that if I'm being honest," she said.
Jordan Ngatikaura said he felt like he's had the opportunity to address "traumas" from his past and avoid falling back into old habits.
"Before all of this, I didn't know why you would act certain ways or treat me certain ways. You didn't know why I would pull away and avoid things," Jessi Ngatikaura said.
She went on to explain that therapy taught her that her husband's "aggression" comes from childhood wounds and becoming a dad as a teenager.

"There's so much that I understand now about you. And not that it makes your behavior OK, but I understand it now and it's changing, which is the most important part," Jessi Ngatikaura said, adding that she's also made her own progress with being more emotionally available for her husband.
In a confessional interview, Jessi Ngatikaura opened up about what therapy has taught her about herself.

"I've seen how being avoidant has hurt my relationships. And in our culture, there is a lot of pressure to have the perfect relationship, the perfect family and everything's great. And I think that it kind of taught me these patterns to go numb and avoid and pretend everything's OK," she said.
"And if I'm going to make the marriage work, I need to drop that and I'm willing to do that because Jordan has made so many changes. And I want to make sure that I'm doing the same thing."

title: You’ll Never Believe How Many Bridesmaids Jenna Had at Her Wedding
summary: Jenna Bush revealed on TODAY with Jenna & Friends that she had 19 bridesmaids when she married Henry Hager in 2008.
story: Narrowing down a list of bridesmaids for your wedding can be challenging. Just ask Jenna Bush Hager.
While chatting with guest co-host Leslie Bibb about weddings on Nov. 14, Jenna admitted that she had quite a few friends stand up for her when she married Henry Hager in 2008.
"How many bridesmaids did you have in your wedding?" Bibb asked.
"Too many," Jenna replied.
"How many?" Bibb repeated and playfully raised her voice.
"Too many," Jenna repeated.
"How many is too many?" Bibb asked.
After explaining that she only asked twin sister Barbara Pierce Bush to stand at the altar with her, Jenna revealed that she had 19 bridesmaids in total.
Bibb's jaw dropped in shock. Other people in Studio 1A were equally surprised by Jenna's response.
"Don't judge! Look at everybody's faces. That's a room full of shame," Jenna said.
"That's not shame," Bibb began.
"That's disgust. I see disgust on your face," Jenna said, addressing the room.
Bibb still couldn't get over it and said "I don't think I've ever known anybody to have (that many bridesmaids)."
"Oh look at Ashley. Everybody's shaming me, Both Ashleys. OK, I know," Jenna said.
Bibb was curious to know if all of Jenna's bridesmaids wore the same thing. She said they wore "color coordinated" outfits.
"I let them pick their style. I'll let them do everything," Jenna said.
The mother of three shared she was just discussing bridesmaids dresses with her 12-year-old daughter Mila the other day.

"I have different sketches by fashion designers in my bathroom. Oscar de la Renta did my wedding dress, and he drew the sketch so I have that there. But I have my bridesmaids dresses with the fabrics. And Mila goes, 'You had them all wear those?' And I was like, 'Yeah.' And she's like, 'That's a choice,'" Jenna said.
Jenna, who celebrated her 17th wedding anniversary in May 2025, has shared several details from her big day over the years, including the Bible verses her grandparents read at the ceremony.
In 2021, Jenna also opened up about a sweet moment she shared with her father, George W. Bush, on the day.
“I think my dad picked me up in a pickup truck, in his pickup truck, and he said, ‘You look beautiful, baby,’ and then we both just wept,” she said on TODAY with Hoda & Jenna.

title: Quinn Daly, Carson’s Sister and Hallmark Superfan, Goes to Magical Premiere of ‘Bills Love Story’ Movie
summary: Carson Daly's sister, Quinn, covered the premiere of the upcoming Hallmark movie “Holiday Touchdown: A Bills Love Story.”
story: Have yourself a very Daly Christmas.

Carson Daly’s sister, Quinn Daly, recently attended the premiere of the upcoming Hallmark movie “Holiday Touchdown: A Bills Love Story” as part of its “Countdown to Christmas.” The film centers on the NFL’s Buffalo Bills.
Quinn is a huge fan of Hallmark’s Christmas movies and was invited to attend the premiere in East Aurora, New York, a small town just outside of Buffalo where the movie was shot.
Quinn got ready first by shopping at Vidlers, a store in town seen in the film. After filling up on various items, she got ready for the premiere itself by getting her hair and makeup done.
“Oh my god, I look so good!” she said. “I feel like I’m 35!”
After putting on a sequined Bills jacket and Christmas hat, Quinn paused to explain just why she enjoys Hallmark Christmas movies so much.
“I love Hallmark movies because my mom loved Christmas. My mom was Christmas. And the first time I saw a Hallmark Christmas movie was in her house,” she said while getting a little emotional.

“So now when I watch a Hallmark Christmas movie, I really feel like my mom’s there. There’s always a happy ending. There’s always just like fun and joy in these movies. They just mean a lot. And so it’s just incredible to be here.”
Quinn then hitched a ride to the premiere with the cast of the film, which includes Matthew Daddario, Tracy Pollan, Steve Schirripa, Holland Roden, Caroline Aaron, Joe Pantoliano and Patti Murin.
“That was amazing,” she said.
In the film, Daddario and Roden play characters whose families love the Bills.
“It feels like one of those holiday yester-year movies,” Roden told Quinn. “It has a lot of nostalgia from like either the 1970s, 1990s, football mania.”
Murin is a veteran of the Hallmark movie circuit, who addressed the chatter that this film may have been inspired by Bills quarterback Josh Allen’s marriage to Hailee Steinfeld.
“Well, I know that he was getting married right when we were filming it,” she told Quinn. “So, that was really cool to be here while they were in their offseason, but doing some life things.”
Schirripa, who’s known for his work on “The Sopranos,” said Hallmark movies offer a nice alternative.
“You know what’s great about Hallmark? There’s no shooting, no killing, no arguing,” he told Quinn.
“Holiday Touchdown: A Bills Love Story” features cameos by a few Bills players, including Damar Hamlin, DeWayne Carter and Ray Davis.
Carter said he may do more acting down the line.
“I mean, of course. You know, a fun fact about me, I’m actually a theatre minor,” he said.
Davis, meanwhile, is in awe that he was part of the film.
“It was insane. It was crazy, just to be able to even say I’m even in a movie,” he said.
Quinn then participated in Hallmark’s festive “Peppermint Procession” from the red carpet to the movie theater, with fans cheering “Let’s go Buffalo!” along the way, while snow fell from the sky.
“This night just keeps getting better! It’s like the end of a Hallmark movie when it suddenly starts to snow,” she said.
“Holiday Touchdown: A Bills Love Story” premieres Nov. 22 at 8 p.m. ET. It will stream the next day on Hallmark+.

title: Cardi B Gives Birth to Baby No. 4, First With Boyfriend Stefon Diggs
summary: Cardi B has welcomed her fourth child, and her first with boyfriend and NFL star Stefon Diggs.
story: Cardi B is officially a mom of four.
The 33-year-old rapper welcomed a baby boy with NFL star and boyfriend Stefon Diggs, Cardi's rep confirmed to TODAY.com on Nov. 13.
No additional information was shared at this time.

The news comes after she posted an Instagram video of herself strutting to her song “Hello.” In the caption, she wrote how her life has recently been a “combination of different chapters and different seasons.”
Now starting over and in a “new season,” she shared that it’s “never easy but it’s been so worth it,” before touching on motherhood.

“I brought new music and a new album to the world! A new baby into my world, and one more reason to be the best version of me, one more reason to love me more than anything else or anyone else so I can continue giving my babies the love and life they deserve,” she wrote in part.
Cardi revealed in a Sept. 17 CBS News interview that she was pregnant with her fourth child, and first with the New England Patriots wide receiver.

“I’m having a baby with my boyfriend, Stefon Diggs,” she told Gayle King. “I’m excited. I’m happy. I feel like I’m in a good space. I feel very strong, I feel very powerful that I’m doing all this work, but I’m doing all this work while I’m creating a baby.”
At the time, she said that her baby would be born ahead of her 2026 tour.
Cardi is also mother to three children with rapper Offset: daughter Kulture, son Wave and daughter Blossom born in 2024. She filed for divorce from Offset for a second time in 2024.
Diggs, meanwhile, is also father to a daughter from a previous relationship.
During an Oct. 6 episode of the “On Purpose with Jay Shetty” podcast, Cardi shared spoke about supporting her children and her worst parenting fear.

“Please don’t be lazy,” she told Jay Shetty. “Don’t be a bum ... please don’t be lazy... Some people have the look, the intelligence, the talent. Some people really have that. But they don’t go nowhere because they’re lazy. Don’t be lazy!”
She added that she would be willing to financially assist her kids into adulthood, but hopes they “become something.”

“Even when they’re 18 ... and it’s time to leave, if you want an apartment, if you want a car, I’ll give it to you, but please, please become something,” she said. “Please don’t be nothing. That would be the worst disappointment they could ever do. Don’t disappoint me like that.”

title: Former 'DWTS' Host Tom Bergeron Apologizes to Bobby Bones for Comments About His Season 27 Win
summary: Tom Bergeron's return to "Dancing With the Stars" this week caused major drama with Season 27 champion Bobby Bones
story: Tom Bergeron's return to "Dancing With the Stars" this week caused major drama with Season 27 champion Bobby Bones.

In a Nov. 12 Instagram video, Bones shared that it was "hurtful" hearing former host Bergeron's comments about his controversial win with pro Sharna Burgess in 2019 and also revealed that he returned his Mirrorball trophy to ABC.

Bergeron served as a guest judge on the dance competition’s Nov. 11 "20th Birthday Party" episode. During an interview with Parade ahead of the episode, he was asked to name the most surprising eliminations from his years as host.

"The thing that shocked me most was a win — Bobby Bones," he responded. "That was when I went, 'Uhh.' .... Bobby Bones was the first time ... it was like, 'Ouch.' No disrespect to Bobby. He would probably say the same thing."
Bones clapped back at Bergeron's snub in his video.

"This was hurtful and not because of what was said, but really who said it ... Am I supposed to not show up and work hard? Am I supposed to not give it freaking everything that I have? Am I supposed to throw it and not win?” he said.

"It’s crazy the amount of hate I get even from people that I respect like Tom Bergeron there and Julianne Hough ...I feel like a sixth-grader and all the 9th grade dancing kids are shoving me in lockers," Bones continued. (Hough appeared on "Watch What Happens Live with Andy Cohen" in August 2024 and agreed with fellow guest Mickey Guyton that Bones was the winner they "strongly disagreed with," E! News reported at the time. Hough also said Bones "was not the best dancer.")
The radio host said the many "random shots" he's received from DWTS personalities have "taken all the joy" out of his win.

“I had a great attitude, I worked hard and here we are six years later, I’m still catching strays out of nowhere," he said. "So I sent the trophy back. They don't want me to be a part of the show, obviously."
Bones did not clarify in the clip when he decided to return his Mirrorball trophy.
Following Bones' video, Bergeron apologized in a direct message, sharing a screenshot of it on his Instagram story.
“Bobby, it wasn’t my intention to hurt your feelings. My ‘ouch’ was based on my honest feeling that your win spoke to a need to address the balance between judge and viewer voting," Bergeron wrote.
He further explained, "I always felt bad that both you & Sharna had to deal with the aftermath of that win & I certainly regret pouring any salt into that old wound."
At the top of his screenshot, Bergeron wrote, "I was doing so many interviews leading up to the 20th, I was bound to say something inelegantly," and added a facepalming emoji.

Bones and Burgess won Season 27 in 2018, besting runners-up Milo Manheim and pro Witney Carson. When the competition show returned for Season 28, a new element was added that allowed the judges to save one of the bottom two couples every week.
Currently, the judges' scores are combined with the viewers' votes every week to determine who goes home.

title: Chili’s ‘Wicked’ Margaritas Are Apparently Wicked Strong
summary: Chili’s "Wicked" margaritas of the month are giving people wicked hangovers, according to multiple viral TikToks.
story: A pair of green and pink drinks are causing customers to defy gravity.

“Wicked: For Good,” is hitting theaters on Nov. 21 and, in the lead-up to Elphaba (Cynthia Erivo) and Glinda (Ariana Grande) belting their way into our hearts once more, food brands and restaurants have released “Wicked” treats: churros, cereal, macaroni and so much more.
But no collab has intoxicated people quite like Chili’s “Wicked” Margaritas — literally.
All over TikTok, customers are sipping, slurping, gulping and, in some cases, double-fisting Chili’s movie-themed margaritas.

The Good Witch Marg is pink in Glinda’s aesthetic and made with blanco tequila, triple sec, dragon fruit syrup, sour mix and topped with soda water and a swizzle stick wand.The Witches Brew Marg is green like Elphaba and has blanco tequila, blue curacao, granny smith apple syrup, sour mix and garnished with a swizzle stick shaped like a broom with a witch’s hat on top.
The Good Witch Marg is pink in Glinda’s aesthetic and made with blanco tequila, triple sec, dragon fruit syrup, sour mix and topped with soda water and a swizzle stick wand.
The Witches Brew Marg is green like Elphaba and has blanco tequila, blue curacao, granny smith apple syrup, sour mix and garnished with a swizzle stick shaped like a broom with a witch’s hat on top.
Both margaritas cost $6 each. When cocktails these days can go for $20 or more these days, Chili’s drinks have become rather — wait for it — popular.
And so, it seems, people are overindulging on these potions.
“Why would they try to get you drunk off of a six dollar margarita immediately,” says TikToker @_yagirlj_. The on-screen caption asks, “why the Wicked margaritas so potent???? Omggg.”
Indeed, revelers are waking up post-Chili’s with a hangover so bad that just hearing Cynthia Erivo’s “Defying Gravity” vocal run could send them to the hospital.
No one, though, has quite become the face of this phenomenon quite like one 27-year-old in Utah, who first posted a viral review of the drinks, then the aftermath of his night.

“If you go to Chili’s to try the new ‘Wicked’ margaritas, don’t have seven of them,” Thorn says in a video with millions of views. He appears to have just woken up from a deep slumber, worse for the wear. “Just have two. Just try the green, try the pink and leave it at that. Take it from me, okay?”
He brings the phone closer to his face.
“The pink one was so good. Those are the best margaritas I’ve ever had in my life,” he emphasizes before groaning. “But I literally feel obliterated right now.”
“you got a Wicked hangover,” commented one user on TikTok.
“have you been changed....for good?” joked another.
One concerned soul said, “hi i bartend at chilis…SEVEN?” then added, “seven is just a LOT those ones are STRONG.”
George Felix, Chili’s chief marketing officer, says, “We’ve had a blast bringing a little magic to our Margarita of the Month lineup this fall."

“Our guests are pulling their phones out the second The Witches Brew and Good Witch Margs hit the table,” he adds, “and we’ve loved watching how guests are getting into the fun and sharing that over-the-top energy on social.”
For Thorn, who has been back to Chili’s for more margs since his big night, it’s been fun to see the excitement from everyone on social media.

“The last time I went to Chili’s, I had people come up and tell me they were there to try the drinks because of my videos which I thought was so special and truly a dream come true!” he tells TODAY.com.
“Chili’s, ‘Wicked’ and margaritas are my three favorite things. I will be going back as many times as I can before the drinks are gone!”

title: Why Kim Kardashian Said She Needed To Pass The Bar Exam 'on the 1st Try'
summary: On the latest episode of "The Kardashians," Kim Kardashian revealed how she feels about taking the bar exam and said she hopes to pass the test on the first try.
story: Kim Kardashian said she had no room for error when it came to the California bar exam.
In the latest episode of "The Kardashians," which was filmed three months before Kardashian took the bar exam and failed, she explained why she needed to pass the test on the first try.
The reality TV star said she spent about "nine hours a day" studying and was happy to wrap her Hulu show "All's Fair" so she could focus more on her studies.
“I’m really just excited to have ‘All’s Fair’ wrapped and behind me so that I can just dive right on into studying and make that my No. 1 focus," she said on Season 7, Episode 4, of the series.
In a confessional, Kardashian admitted that she was feeling "exhausted."
When a producer asked her if she was "nervous" about taking the bar, she responded, yes.

“Yeah! Absolutely. I’m not ready yet," she said. "You know, you feel like you don’t know anything and then it all clicks and then you feel like you don’t know it. It’s just the craziest, most emotional roller coaster."
"I really do need to pass on the first try," Kardashian added. "I don’t have another few months I can give up."

The State Bar of California released the results of its July 2025 exam on Nov. 7, announcing that 54.8% of exam takers passed. Just over 7,300 people took the test, 73.9% of which were first-time test takers. The pass rate for first-time takers was 69.7%, per the state bar.
Kardashian’s name was not included in the publicly available pass list.

She spoke about failing the bar in a TikTok video that she filmed while getting ready for her mother's 70th birthday party. Kardashian told someone on the phone that fortune tellers had inaccurately predicted her future.

“I’m just letting you guys know that all of the f--king psychics that we have met with and that we’re obsessed with are all f--king full of s--t," she said angrily. “They all collectively — maybe four of them have told me that I was going to pass the bar, so they’re all full pathological liars. Don't believe anything they say."
Last May, Kardashian completed her law program after six years of studying. Now that she's failed the bar, she'll have to re-take the test. The bar is given twice a year, in July and February.

title: How to Watch the 2025 Latin Grammys Tonight
summary: When are the 2025 Latin Grammys? Find out the day and time of the event, as well as the performers, nominations and how to watch and stream the awards ceremony.
story: The 2025 Latin Grammys will be one jam-packed show with the biggest names in Latin music in attendance.
Taking place tonight, Thursday, Nov. 13, the 26th annual Latin Grammy Awards return to Las Vegas after they were held in Miami last year.

The 2025 celebration will be a three-hour telecast filled with awards being handed out and performances by some of the most influential hitmakers, like Bad Bunny, who is up for 12 awards tonight. The show will celebrate Spanish singer Raphael, the 2025 Person of the Year, as well.
Actor Roselyn Sánchez returns as host, along with Colombian singer Maluma, who is making his hosting debut. This will be Sánchez's eighth time emceeing the event.

You will not want to miss all the excitement. The show will also feature a performance by Kacey Musgraves, who recently released a crossover collaboration with Carín León called “Lost in Translation.”
Read on to find out how to watch the 2025 Latin Grammy Awards, below.
What Day Are the 2025 Latin Grammys?
The 2025 Latin Grammy Awards will be held at the MGM Grand Garden Arena in Las Vegas on Thursday, Nov. 13.
What Time Do the 2025 Latin Grammys Start?
The awards show starts at 5 p.m. PT/8 p.m. ET.
Ahead of the ceremony, a one-hour pre-show will begin at 4 p.m. PT/7 p.m. ET, airing on Univision.
How to Watch and Stream the 2025 Latin Grammys
The Latin Grammys will air live on Univision and across TelevisaUnivision’s U.S platforms beginning at 8 p.m. ET/PT (7 p.m. Central).
Ahead of the televised show, the 2025 Latin Grammy Premiere ceremony will stream live across all Latin Recording Academy platforms, including YouTube, beginning at 12 p.m. PT/3 p.m. ET.
A majority of the awards, in categories and genres like rock, flamenco, hip-hop, electronic music and more, will be revealed during the 2025 Latin Grammy Premiere.
Who Is Performing?

There is a long list of performers who have joined the 2025 Latin Grammys lineup, including Bad Bunny, CA7RIEL & Paco Amoroso, Karol G, Jesús Ortiz Paz (Fuerza Regida), Chuwi, Fuerza Regida and Marco Antonio Solís.

They join previously announced performers Pepe Aguilar, Aitana, Rauw Alejandro, Edgar Barrera, Ivan Cornejo, DannyLux, Gloria Estefan, Joaquina, Kakalo, Carín León, Liniker, Morat, Christian Nodal, Los Tigres del Norte, Nathy Peluso, Elena Rose, Alejandro Sanz and Adelaido “Payo” Solís III (Grupo Frontera), as well as Grupo Frontera, Kacey Musgraves, Carlos Santana and the 2025 Person of the Year, Raphael.
Who Is Nominated?
There are over 50 categories included in the 2025 Latin Grammys. Bad Bunny leads the list of top nominees with 12. See a few of the general field categories, below.
Record of the Year

“Baile Inolvidable” — Bad Bunny“DtMF” — Bad Bunny“El Día Del Amigo” — CA7RIEL & Paco Amoroso“#Tetas” — CA7RIEL & Paco Amoroso“Desastres Fabulosos” — Jorge Drexler & Conociendo Rusia“Lara” — Zoe Gotusso“Si Antes Te Hubiera Conocido” — Karol G“Cancionera” — Natalia Lafourcade“Ao Teu Lado” — Liniker“Palmeras En El Jardín” — Alejandro Sanz
